byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Milwaukee, and Patrick Healy from New York.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and PATRICK HEALY

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton opens new directions of attack against Sen Bernie Sanders in Milwaukee presidential debate, challenging his trillion-dollar policy plans as unrealistic and underscoring her foreign policy experience; Clinton, fresh off losing New Hampshire Democratic primary, is under pressure to counter Sanders's growing popularity ahead of contests in South Carolina and Nevada.
lead_paragraph: Defeated soundly in New Hampshire, Mrs. Clinton sought to puncture her rival’s popularity and appeal to new regions of voters.

headline.main: In Democratic Debate, Hillary Clinton Paints Bernie Sanders’s Plans as Unrealistic
headline.print_headline: Clinton Paints Sanders Plans as Unrealistic

snippet: Defeated soundly in New Hampshire, Mrs. Clinton sought to puncture her rival’s popularity and appeal to new regions of voters.
